name: Military Retirement Income Tax Exclusion
description: Exclude up to $20,000 of military retirement or Survivor Benefit Plan income from California state taxes annually
fullDescription: Starting in 2025, California veterans receiving military retirement pay can exclude up to $20,000 annually from state income taxes. Surviving spouses receiving Survivor Benefit Plan payments also qualify for this new tax break.
whatTheyOffer:
- Exclude up to $20,000 military retirement pay from state taxes
- Survivor Benefit Plan payments also eligible
- Available to military retirees of all ages
- Surviving spouses qualify independently
- Reduces California state income tax liability
howToGetIt:
1. Must receive military retirement pay or SBP payments
2. Must file California state income tax return
3. Claim exclusion on California tax return (Form 540)
4. Follow FTB instructions for military retirement exclusion
5. Keep documentation of military retirement income
